TopicTitle: Scatterer turns all planets with atmosphere white

Articles.Content:
Hey all! So I decided I wanted to start a modded career game after I had been away from the game for a while, and I downloaded a bunch of mods, including Scatterer. When I loaded up a new, clean career save, the ocean and atmosphere on Kerbin were completely white, however, the terrain was just fine. I checked around in the tracking station, and I realized it did the same thing to every planet/moon that had an atmosphere. However, bodies like Tylo, Eeloo, and Bop were fine, since they had no atmospheres. And the game turns back to normal colors once I reach space. I installed it like this: KSP/GameData/GameData (which I renamed Scatterer for easier entry)/scatterer. Anything I did wrong? Please help!

P.S. I turned off and tweaked various settings of Scatterer eg. godrays, terrain shadows, accurate sky reflections for oceans, etc.

1 hour ago, ThatKSPGuy said:

I installed it like this: KSP/GameData/GameData (which I renamed Scatterer for easier entry)/scatterer.

Try to remove one of the 'scatterer' folders, it should look like:

  • GameData
    • scatterer
      • config
      • shaders
      • scatterer.dll

This applies to all mods. You can drop the whole 'GameData' folder provided from a mod and drop it in your KSP install folder (which already contains a GameData folder). This will merge these folders and everything should be in the correct place.

Hi,I have the same problem but it didnt work for me because in my scatterer folder is just the config,Icon,shaders and scatterer.dll so I´ve just deleted the Icon wich doesnt make sense but then I have all the folders in the scatterer folder u mentioned

but It still doesnt work.maybe its just outdated or something..
